DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate safety tolerability GS-9674 adult primary sclerosing cholangitis ( PSC ) .
DOC.brief_title: Safety , Tolerability , Efficacy GS-9674 Adults With Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis Without Cirrhosis
DOC.criteria: Key Diagnosis PSC base cholangiogram ( magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography ( MRCP ) , endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography ( ERCP ) , percutaneous transhepatic cholangiogram ( PTC ) ) within previous 12 month Serum alkaline phosphatase ( ALP ) > 1.67 x upper limit normal range ( ULN ) For individual ursodeoxycholic acid ( UDCA ) , dose UDCA must stable least 12 month prior screen end treatment . For individual UDCA , UDCA use least 12 month screen end treatment Screening FibroSURE/FibroTest® < 0.75 unless historical liver biopsy within 12 month screen reveal cirrhosis . In adult Gilbert 's syndrome hemolysis , FibroSURE/FibroTest® calculate use direct bilirubin instead total bilirubin . Key Alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) > 10 x ULN Total bilirubin > 2 x ULN International normalize ratio ( INR ) > 1.2 unless anticoagulant therapy Smallduct PSC ( histologic evidence PSC normal bile duct cholangiography ) Other cause liver disease include secondary sclerosing cholangitis viral , metabolic , alcoholic , autoimmune condition Ascending cholangitis within 60 day screen Presence percutaneous drain bile duct stent Use fibrates obeticholic acid within 3 month prior screen end treatment Cirrhosis liver define follow : Historical liver biopsy demonstrate cirrhosis ( eg , Ludwig stage 4 Ishak stage ≥ 5 ) Prior history decompensated liver disease , include ascites , hepatic encephalopathy variceal bleed Liver stiffness > 14.4 kPa FibroScan Current , active inflammatory bowel disease ( IBD ) define partial Mayo score > 1 and/or score Rectal Bleeding domain > 0 . Note : Other protocol define Inclusion/Exclusion criterion may apply .
